. It is also a major transportation hub in Java, connecting other major cities in Java, such as
Purwokerto is a town of 300,000 inhabitants. Commonly referred as a cross-road between

. The town is on the foothill of Gunung Slamet volcano, the highest volcano in Central Java. Purwokerto also the main entrance to climb Gunung Slamet. Many of Indonesian famous people originated from Purwokerto, namely Jendral Sudirman, Jendral Gatot Subroto, Soepardjo Roestam etc. Most of those heroic people are honoured as a street name all over Indonesia.
on 10 hectares area, clean, save and comfort located 4 km to the south of the town center.  There are regular services throughout the island, including

(4 to 5.5 hours) with Raharja and Efisiensi bus,

(6 to 8 hours) with Budiman and Goodwill bus.
The terminal serves for 24 hours.

value: Jenderal Sudirman Street, one of the busiest street in town

Purwokerto is a relatively small city, travelling around town should not be too expensive. You may jog around town for 40 minutes.
Traditional three-wheeled pedal-powered carts known as
can be found in most part of Purwokerto.

Although Purwokerto is a small city, travelling around town can be more faster and easier by angkot (a van that carries passengers, very common in Indonesia). Always have direct routes but sometimes can be very crowded. Costs Rp 2500 per person.

Purwokerto has many beautiful buildings and monuments. 

[[File:Bank BRI Museum Purwokerto.jpg|thumb|350px|Bank BRI Museum, one of the city's main attraction.

value: , is a well known landmark located in front of train station. The flyover was built in 1967.
, a Dutch colonial architecture, many Dutch residential building can be located in front of the train station.
, located in Jalan Bank, a museum dedicated for R.A. Wiriatmaja who pioneer the Indonesian banking system.

(Jalan Dr Suharso) is known as the largest sport complex in town. Contains a football stadium, tennis courts, reflection park, and a few other venues. Usually, locals visit place in the morning, especially on Sunday.
: One of the most popular entertainment program in town, especially for the locals. Plenty of well-known chains spread throughout the city, such as
(Jalan Jenderal Sudirman, close to Pasar Wage),
(Jalan Jenderal Sudirman, across the Satria Plaza), and
: Another famous entertainment activity in town. There are a few pool places in town, such as
(Jalan Dr Angka, Tirta Kembar Amusement Center).

(Jalan Dr Angka, Dynasty Entertainment Center) is the most-known and the best club in town, also comes with new concept of Cafe - Club - Party. A lot of Indonesian famous singers and bands held their stage here.

The biggest traditional market is Pasar Wage. There are also several small traditional markets, such as Pasar Manis and Pasar Pon.

There are a number of boutique and distro along the HR Bunyamin Street, in the northern part of the city. Mostly visited by the youths and college students.

, the first department store chain in Purwokerto. There are 2 in Purwokerto, one in Kebon Dalem and the other newest one in Jenderal Sudirman Street, close to Moro Mall and Tamara Plaza.
department store and supermarket owned by PT Matahari Putra Prima Tbk.

There are plenty of handcrafts and souvenirs stands in the nearby, Baturaden, a cool resort-town just 14 km to the north.
The following dishes should be on every traveller's agenda:

value: , a curry of jackfruit, chicken and egg served with rice, and is the most famous local dish.  The most famous gudeg seller is in front of Pasar Manis, Jalan Gatot Subroto.

is local food in Purwokerto, from a very slim Tempe (food from a fermented soy bean, very famous food in Java) and covered by dough of wheat flour. Although many places selling Mendoan, the best Mendoan only served in the village. Even though Mendoan sold at city is considerable tasty.
Sate Kambing in Purwokerto Area (Banyumas, Sokaraja, Purbalingga) is also famous for very tender young Goat. One of the best is Sate Tiga Saudara.

, available in Sokaraja, located 4 km west of Purwokerto. Many of Soto Sokaraja in here, considered one of the best is Soto Kecik. The place not so good but very famous. Another famous one (some people consider this soto is better) is Soto Sutri.
available in HR.Benyamin 2 KM from Limas Agung.

Mendoan can be bought at jalan Sawangan, such as Mirasa, Echo21, etc. You can buy it raw (with separated ingredient) and frying it at home.

value: , Pekih Street, north of Grand Mosque and City Square. Open 9am - 3pm approx.

At Sokaraja we also found the famous food called Gethuk Goreng that many shops sell with different kinds of names. It made of cassava and a lot of Javanese sugar. And the other food: nopia, mino (small nopia) kripik, and also mendoan.
, Prof Dr Suharso Street, a blend of Indonesian and Japanese restaurant, offers siomay, bakso, and Japanese cuisine such as Okonomiyaki, Takoyaki, Ramen, and Yakimesi.
